intro: Peucedanum opopanax, commonly known as the Persian cumin or opopanax, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to regions of the Middle East and Central Asia, including parts of Turkey, Iran, and Afghanistan. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. Its roots and seeds are used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. The plant's aromatic compounds contribute to its use in culinary and medicinal applications across various cultures.
